column1: One day her mother said to her: "Come
column3: I want you to go and see your grandmother
column4: and take her a piece of cake and a bottle of wine; for she is ill and weak
column5: and this will do her good. Make haste and get ready before the weather gets too hot
column6: and go straight on your road while you are out
column7: and behave prettily and modestly; and do not run
column8: for fear you should fall and break the bottle
column9: and then grandmother would have no wine. And when you pass through the village
column10: do not forget to courtesy and say ‘Good-morning' to every one who knows you.""I will do everything you tell me
column12: said the child as she wished her good-by and started for her long walk.It was quite half an hour's walk through the wood from the village to the grandmother's house, and no sooner had Red Riding-Hood entered the wood than she met a wolf.
